database package

Submodules

database.addUser module

This module contains the functions related to add a user to the database.

database.addUser.add_user(connection: Connection, email: str, username: str, password: str)[source]

Add a new user to the database.

Parameters:

  • connection (sqlite3.Connection) – The connection to the database.

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • password (str) – The password of the user.

Returns:

None.

database.addUser.create_user()[source]

Create a new user and verify if the email, username and password are valid. If so, add the user to the database.

Raises:

SystemExit – If the email, username or password is not valid.

database.addUser.get_username(connection: Connection, user_id: int) → str[source]

Get the username of a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • connection (sqlite3.Connection) – Connection object to the database.

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

Returns:

A string representing the username of the user.

database.addUser.hash_password(password: str) → str[source]

Hash a password using SHA256.

Parameters:

password (str) – The password to hash.

Returns:

A string representing the hashed password.

database.addUser.verify_email(email: str)[source]

Check if the given email address is valid.

Parameters:

email (str) – A string representing the email.

Raises:

SystemExit – If the email doesnt not match email type.

database.addUser.verify_password(password: str, confirmation: str) → bool[source]

Verify if two passwords match.

Parameters:

  • password (str) – The password to verify.

  • confirmation (str) – The confirmation of the password.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

Bool

Raises:

SystemExit – If the passwords do not match.

database.addUser.verify_username(connection: Connection, username: str) → bool[source]

Verify if a username already exists in the database.

Parameters:

  • connection (database.Connection) – The connection to the database.

  • username (str) – The username to verify.

Returns:

True if the username does not exist, False otherwise.

Return type:

Bool

Raises:

SystemExit – If the username already exists in the database.

database.deleteUser module

This module contains the functions related to delete a user from the database.

database.deleteUser.delete_user(connection: Connection, user_id: int)[source]

Deletes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • connection (sqlite3.Connection) – Connection object to the database.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user to be deleted.

database.deleteUser.get_user_id(connection: Connection, username: str, password_hash: str) → int[source]

Checks if the user is in the database and if the hash of the input password matches the hash in the database.

Parameters:

  • connection (sqlite3.Connection) – Connection object to the database.

  • username (str) – Username of the user attempting to log in.

  • password_hash (str) – Hashed password of the user attempting to log in.

Returns:

The user’s ID if creds are valids, -1 otherwise.

Return type:

int

database.deleteUser.hash_password(password: str) → str[source]

Hash a password using SHA256.

Parameters:

password (str) – A string representing the password.

Returns:

A string representing the hashed password.

database.gestion module

This module contains functions to read and write to the database, as well as functions to hash passwords and verify email addresses.

database.gestion.exit_error(message: str, objectToReturn: int = 1) → None[source]

Print an error message and exit the program.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – A string representing the error message.

  • objectToReturn (int) – An object to return when exiting the program.

Returns:

None.

Raises:

systemExit – An exception that exits the program with the objectToReturn code.

database.gestion.read(connection: Connection, request: Tuple | str, many: bool = False) → List[Tuple][source]

Executes a SELECT statement on the database and returns the results as a list of tuples.

Parameters:

  • connection (database.Connection) – a SQLite3 database connection object

  • request (Union[Tuple, str]) – the SQL SELECT statement to execute

  • many (bool) – True if the statement should be executed multiple times with different data, False otherwise

Returns:

a list of tuples containing the results of the SELECT statement

database.gestion.return_error(message: str, objectToReturn: int = 1)[source]

Print an error message and return an object.

Parameters:

  • message (str) – A string representing the error message.

  • objectToReturn (int) – An object to return when exiting the program.

Returns:

An object to return when exiting the program.

Return type:

objectToReturn (int)

database.gestion.write(connection: Connection, request: Tuple | str, many: bool = False)[source]

Executes an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement on the database and commits the changes.

Parameters:

  • connection (database.Connection) – a SQLite3 database connection object

  • request (Union[Tuple, str]) – the SQL INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement to execute

  • many (bool) – True if the statement should be executed multiple times with different data, False otherwise

database.initDatabase module

This module contains the functions related to the database initialization.

database.initDatabase.create_tables(connection: Connection)[source]

Create the tables in the database.

Parameters:

connection (database.Connection) – a SQLite3 database connection object

database.initDatabase.fill_user(connection: Connection)[source]

Fill the users table with some data.

Parameters:

connection (database.Connection) – a SQLite3 database connection object

database.initDatabase.init_database(connection: Connection)[source]

Initialise the database.

Parameters:

connection (database.Connection) – a SQLite3 database connection object

database.mail module

This module contains the functions related to the mail sending.

database.mail.get_all_emails(connection: Connection) → list[str][source]

Gets the email addresses of all users from the database.

Parameters:

connection (sqlite3.Connection) – Connection object to the database.

Returns:

A list of all the user’s email addresses.

Return type:

list

database.mail.get_creds() → Credentials[source]

Gets the credentials from the user’s machine.

Returns:

Credentials object containing the user’s credentials.

Return type:

Credentials

database.mail.send_email(recipient: str, subject: str, body: str)[source]

Sends an email to the specified recipient using the Gmail API.

Parameters:

  • recipient (string) – email that will receive the notification.

  • subject (string) – subject of the notification.

  • body (string) – body the notification.

database.mail.send_mail_to_all(subject: str, body: str)[source]

Sends an email to all users in the database.

Parameters:

  • subject (string) – subject of the notification.

  • body (string) – body the notification.

database.printDatabase module

This module contains a function to print the content of the database.

database.printDatabase.print_tables(connection)[source]

Read and print the content of all tables in the database.

Parameters:

connection (sqlite3.connection) – Connection object to the database.

Returns:

None.

database.sensor module

This module contains the functions related to the sensors. Sensor object and functions to manage the sensors in the database.

database.sensor.add_sensor_data(deveui: int, rssi: int, time: str, value: int)[source]

Add the data of a sensor to the database.

Parameters:

  • deveui (Integer) – The deveui of the sensor.

  • rssi (Integer) – The fm rssi of the sensor (<= 0)

  • time (String) – The time of the data.

  • value (Integer) – The value of the data.

  • sensor_name (String) – The name of the sensor.
